page.title: 09HOUSING-NEW DEVELOPMENTS
page.content: Most of the land at Godfrey Way and The Maltings was farm land and some of it belonged to the Dunmow Brewery. Jerram,the builders started building in 1976,they hope to finish in 1987. The site covers 8 acres of ground which is divided into 98 plots.The foundations go 2metres below ground and some need concrete piles which go down 10metres because the ground is very soft.Each house takes about 12000 bricks,40bags of cement and 450litres of water.From the time they started building,the prices of houses have doubled and the builders expect the prices to go up dramatically when Stansted Airport expands.There are about 26 men on the site building traditional style houses.They get bricks from the London Brick Company and from Kent.Pickford builders will soon be building new houses in Dunmow.
